nodes.bodyText: Why do we need these new permissions?  Is RESTEasy making a call that should be in a doPriv?  If so, we shouldn't add these permissions; we should add a doPriv where needed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,4 +8,5 @@
     <!-- <webContainer enablemultireadofpostdata="true" /> -->
   	<include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
   	<javaPermission className="java.util.PropertyPermission" name="bvt.prop.HTTP_default" actions="read"/>
+  	<javaPermission className="java.net.SocketPermission" name="*" actions="resolve"/>

nodes.bodyText: I added a doPriv to address the problem and created a RestEasy jira:  https://issues.redhat.com/browse/RESTEASY-2707
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,4 +8,5 @@

nodes.bodyText: Same as above - how is the test failing with Java 2 security enabled?

nodes.diffHunk:

   	<include location="../fatTestPorts.xml"/>
   	<javaPermission className="java.io.FilePermission" name="ALL FILES" actions="read"/>
+  	<javaPermission className="java.net.SocketPermission" name="*" actions="resolve"/>

nodes.bodyText:
We can't add this.  RESTEasy is licensed with Apache v2 and presumably copyrighted by RedHat, so we cannot change the license to EPL or add an IBM copyright to it.
Guess who just finished his Open Source Education! ;-)
